Uh Windows can convert a drive to NTFS without losing data.  You don't need any 3rd party apps such as this to do it.
does this work on vista

the filesystem u got is  FAT32 now Not NAF32, if u want to use ntfs u got much more speed BUT if u want to use ntfs instead of FAT32 u need first to format ur hd(this can with windows, in diskmanager you dont need partition magic for this)than u format it again with windows then u choose the option format as ntfs.
so if u want ntfs u should backup all data on ur harddisk cus everything will be erased.

Wouldn't let me make rescue discs.

Told me there were no removable drives available, but there should be at least the CD drive, and my external USB HD, so don't know what's wrong here.

Concerning the question on passing from Fat32 to NTFS without loosing your files (or formating) it's POSSIBLE !

there is a command called "convert" in dos (start/execute => type "cmd")

This is used particularly for external hard drives which are sold in Fat32 format, when the user wants to put files which are over 4Go, windows sends a message saying that the volume is full, the user gets confused because he has enough place on his hard drive to fit an elephant, so he then reads this comment and finds the answer. So where was I... yes, since Fat32 won't let you put files over 4 Go you need to pass to NTFS, but you don't want too loose your files or don't wnt to do a backup, so you use this Dos command: 

convert e:/fs:ntfs 

(of course you need to click on "start" then execute, then type "cmd" there...)

"e" being the letter of the drive which you want to change from Fat32 to NTFS (I'm precising cause some people may have the letter F: or the letter Z: attributed to their external hard drive)

Then the "convert" command will prompt you to type the actual name of the drive. Type there the actual name of the hard drive.
! Make sure your external hard drive isn't running (just plugged in) !

Key Technologies

    * Partitions hard drive
    * Create, resize, copy partitions
    * Run multiple operating systems

Features

    * Divides hard drive into two or more partitions
    * Runs multiple operating systems on the same PC
    * BootMagic? makes it easy to switch between operating systems
    * Copy, move, resize, split, or merge partitions
    * Guides you through the partitioning process
    * Easy to find, copy and paste files in both Windows® and Linux® partitions
    * Create and modify partitions up to 300GB*
    * Supports USB 2.0, USB 1.1, and FireWire® external drives**
    * Supports and converts partitions among FAT, FAT32, NTFS, Ext2, and Ext3 file systems
    * Enlarge an NTFS partition without restarting computer
    * Resizes NTFS system clusters to the most effective size
